GeneralInformation.School Mission: To educate and nurture the school community for a better Singapore
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Encapsulated within Edgefield Primary School's vision," Lives empowered, Lives touched ", is the strong belief of commitment to inspiring staff and students towards the pursuit of educational excellence. Our Philosophy of Education is defined by a purposeful educational experience anchored on a forward-looking curriculum and a strong emphasis on character and citizenship education. We strive to nurture the Whole Child anchored on the five domains of holistic education -   cognitive, aesthetics, moral, physical and social. Our programmes emphasise the application of critical thinking skills across the subject disciplines and an acquisition of a broad and deep foundation through a wide spectrum of authentic and future-oriented learning experiences. Our strong ethos of care and excellence inspires us to move forward as a family, resulting in a safe, open and nurturing environment to ensure the well-being of the school, its population and its stakeholders.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The school is committed towards building a robust and innovative curriculum to cater to every child's diverse needs and talents.   Our "Values Inculcation Through Dancesports Programme" is one of the two officially recognised Learning for Life Programmes (LLP) in the school. Dancesport combines the artistry of dance with athletic prowess in order to produce a truly captivating performance on the parquet. All our students are given the opportunities to learn basic ballroom dancing including cha-cha, jive, waltz and tango.  In the process, our students grow to be gracious, socially competent, collaborative team players imbued with integrity and respect and ready to give back to community and society.    Our second LLP, "Developing 21st Century Competencies Through Photography" beckons the dreamers, the explorers and the adventurers of today to embark on a journey of self-discovery and photo-journalism. Our pupils' works are filled with stories that capture the broad spectrum of life in our school, our island city and abroad - some creative and hilarious, others thought-provoking and emotionally heart-wrenching.   Our Outdoor Education Programme (OE), an integral part of our holistic education,  aims to develop students' love for outdoor activities, outdoor life skills, environmental awareness as well as provide rich learning experiences for building self-confidence, resilience, ruggedness and tenacity in our pupils, in addition to nurturing teamwork and leadership skills.  Through our EduAct in Environment programme, we aim to heighten environmental consciousness in both staff and students through involving them in recycling activities and other green programmes. Appreciating nature not only has therapeutic benefits, it can also foster a sense of belonging to the Nation - to be part of the land is a definitive, emotional bonding that is important in the process of nation-building.
